Key Match Events: Cleveland outscored Toronto 68-38 in the paint
Raptors made 19 turnovers, leading to 30 points for Cleveland
Quickley fell heavily under his own basket and did not return due to a right pelvic contusion
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers play their home opener against Detroit on Friday night
Toronto hosts former coach Nick Nurse and the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday night
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers won for the first time in five season-opening meetings with Toronto
Raptors forward Scottie Barnes shot 3 for 14 and scored nine points in a disappointing season debut
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Raptors welcomed former stars Damon Stoudamire, T.J. Ford and Jerome Williams back to town
Others: Dean Wade started in place of the injured Max Strus (right ankle) and had eight rebounds
